learningObjectives: Understand the basic life processes of nutrition, respiration, transport, and excretion
Explore how different organisms carry out these life processes
Learn about the structures and functions involved in maintaining life

ncertApproach.conceptualFramework: Understanding life processes through systematic exploration of different organisms
ncertApproach.discoveryOrientation: Hands-on activities and experiments to demonstrate biological concepts

sections.title: What are Life Processes?
sections.summary: Introduction to the fundamental processes that distinguish living organisms from non-living things

keyConcepts.name: Maintenance of Life
keyConcepts.description: Living organisms require continuous processes to maintain their organized structure and function

examples.context: Movement, growth, molecular changes, and repair of structures

sections.title: Nutrition
sections.summary: How organisms obtain and process food for energy and growth

keyConcepts.name: Autotrophic Nutrition
keyConcepts.description: Organisms like green plants that can produce their own food using simple inorganic materials and sunlight

keyConcepts.name: Heterotrophic Nutrition
keyConcepts.description: Organisms that cannot produce their own food and must consume other organisms

examples.context: Conversion of carbon dioxide and water into carbohydrates using sunlight

sections.title: Respiration
sections.summary: Process of breaking down glucose to produce energy

keyConcepts.name: Aerobic Respiration
keyConcepts.description: Cellular respiration using oxygen to completely break down glucose

keyConcepts.name: Anaerobic Respiration
keyConcepts.description: Respiration without oxygen, such as in yeast during fermentation

activities.title: Lime Water Experiment
activities.description: Detecting carbon dioxide in exhaled air

keyConcepts.name: Blood Circulation in Humans
keyConcepts.description: Transport of oxygen, nutrients, and waste through the circulatory system

keyConcepts.name: Plant Transport Systems
keyConcepts.description: Xylem and phloem for moving water, minerals, and photosynthetic products

sections.title: Excretion
sections.summary: Removal of waste products from the body

keyConcepts.name: Kidney Function in Humans
keyConcepts.description: Filtration and removal of nitrogenous waste through nephrons

keyConcepts.name: Waste Removal in Plants
keyConcepts.description: Storage of waste in vacuoles, leaves, or excretion into soil
